newsitem.title: UK: Zeneca says underlying profits up 15 pct.
newsitem.headline: Zeneca says underlying profits up 15 pct.

text.p: British bioscience company Zeneca Group Plc said on Friday that its underlying pre-tax profits in the first four months of 1997 were up 15 percent year-on-year at constant exchange rates.

Chairman Sir Sidney Lipworth told the group's annual meeting that the gain was "at a similar rate to that achieved in the first half of 1996, despite higher costs associated with the development, launch and roll-out of many new products."
Lipworth said the rise in the pound "has had a dampening effect on this growth when reported in sterling...but it has had no effect on the real underlying performance which continues apace."
He said the sale of newly-launched products "continue to meet fully our targets and expectations."

Lipworth said group pre-tax profit before exceptional items had doubled from 442 million stg in 1992 to more than 1.0 billion stg in 1996, with operating profit rising at a compound annual rate of 15 percent.
Shares in Zeneca edged up 10 pence to 1884 pence in late morning trading following the announcement.
